description.narrative: Australia's contribution to the Office of Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) provides core funding to support OCHA to undertake activities to facilitate humanitarian coordination, advocacy and information management. OCHA's unique mission is to mobilise and coordinate effective and principled humanitarian action in partnership with national and international organisations in order to: alleviate human suffering in natural disasters and complex emergencies; advocate the rights of people in need; promote preparedness and prevention; and facilitate sustainable solutions. The overall aim for OCHA is saving more lives by improving humanitarian coordination. OCHA provides leadership on the progressing of humanitarian reform, which comprises humanitarian financing, the humanitarian cluster approach and the humanitarian coordinator system and aims to strengthen humanitarian response to be more equitable, predictable, accountable and effective for those in need.
